intro: Centaurea vulgaris, commonly known as common centaury, is an annual or biennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, whitish hairs. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple-blue central disc, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped, often with serrated edges, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and waste areas. Centaurea vulgaris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
